title: Man narrowly escapes death after another horrific escalator accident in China
text:
The worker trapped in the escalator (Picture: CEN)

A escalator repairman in China has suffered extensive injuries after falling into a moving escalator he was in the process of fixing.

He was pulled inside the device, but thankfully managed to avoid being crushed to death by the machinery.

Disturbing images taken during the rescue operation show how only his head remained visible from the outside.

The unnamed workman was reportedly repairing the device in Beibei District of Chongqing, a major city in south-west China, when he accidentally fell into the escalator.

The outdoor escalator was stopped just in time as the worker was sucked into its moving parts.

The man narrowly managed to escape (Picture: CEN)

Local firefighters were called to free the man from within the machinery as hundreds of terrified shoppers gathered around to watch the drama unfold.

Those fearing the worst for the workman were relieved to hear that he was still alive inside the escalator, although seriously injured and quickly losing consciousness.

Arriving firefighters managed to prise his body from within the device and rush him to hospital.

He is now receiving treatment in the trauma centre of a hospital, but his condition is still unknown.

Reports said the escalator ‘suddenly became operational’ while the guy was working on it.

Investigators have yet to determine the cause of the accident.

Last week a pensioner in Shenzhen, a major city in South Chinaís Guangdong Province, broke his leg after falling through a step-less escalator.

It was the last serious escalator-related injury before this weekís event.

Fear of escalators began in China last summer when a woman threw her child to safety seconds before she fell through a loose panel at the top of a working shopping mall escalator and was crushed to death by the machinery.
description: Man narrowly escapes death after another horrific escalator accident in China
